auth.notes: rosbridge WebSocket transport supports TLS (WSS). Application-layer token auth is achieved via a custom ROS 2 authentication plugin or a reverse proxy. Portarium uses WSS + token header.

events.notes: rosbridge delivers topic messages as server-sent WebSocket frames; push-based streaming.

idempotency.notes: rosbridge mirrors ROS 2 semantics â€” no idempotency key. Service calls correlate via the optional interaction id field.

diff.notes: Portarium can plan subscribe/publish/call_service sequences. Verified effects: read back via topic subscription or service response.

capabilities.notes: Subscribe to any ROS 2 topic (telemetry, status, feedback) via WebSocket.
Publish messages to ROS 2 topics (e.g., cmd_vel for motion). Motion commands are high-safety.
Call ROS 2 services (e.g., SetMode, ClearCostmap). Service idempotency is service-specific.
ROS 2 actions are exposed via rosbridge as combined service calls (send_goal + cancel_goal). Rollback = cancel goal.
Stream any sensor_msgs or nav_msgs telemetry topic via throttled WebSocket subscription.
